item.title: Join Us for WIRED’s AI Power Summit
item.description: On September 15, WIRED is gathering a panel of leaders across technology, politics, and media to tell you everything you need to know about the future of generative AI.

item.title: State Department Agents Are Now Working With ICE on Immigration
item.description: The State Department’s law enforcement arm is now involved in immigration enforcement, an area solidly outside its usual duties. One source compares it to IRS agents investigating espionage at NASA.

item.title: State Department Agents Are Now Working With ICE on Immigration
item.description: The State Department’s law enforcement arm is now involved in immigration enforcement, an area solidly outside its usual duties. One source compares it to IRS agents investigating espionage at NASA.

item.title: The Unexpected Winners of Trump’s Trade War
item.description: Americans are now hit with tariffs when they shop from overseas sellers on eBay and Etsy. Shein and Temu had months to get ahead of the curve.

item.title: The Unexpected Winners of Trump’s Trade War
item.description: Americans are now hit with tariffs when they shop from overseas sellers on eBay and Etsy. Shein and Temu had months to get ahead of the curve.

item.title: FEMA's Chaotic Summer Has Gone From Bad to Worse
item.description: Following a week of strife at the disaster relief agency, Homeland Security secretary Kristi Noem told FEMA employees to “be vocal” about their positive experiences with the Trump administration.

item.title: FEMA's Chaotic Summer Has Gone From Bad to Worse
item.description: Following a week of strife at the disaster relief agency, Homeland Security secretary Kristi Noem told FEMA employees to “be vocal” about their positive experiences with the Trump administration.

item.title: The White House Apparently Ordered Federal Workers to Roll Out Grok 'ASAP'
item.description: A partnership between xAI and the US government fell apart earlier this summer. Then the White House apparently got involved, per documents obtained by WIRED.

item.title: The White House Apparently Ordered Federal Workers to Roll Out Grok 'ASAP'
item.description: A partnership between xAI and the US government fell apart earlier this summer. Then the White House apparently got involved, per documents obtained by WIRED.

item.title: DOGE Operatives Are Joining Donald Trump’s New National Design Studio
item.description: Many proposed NDS projects were already in the works from federal workers who were let go earlier this year. Now, DOGE is getting involved.

item.description: Many proposed NDS projects were already in the works from federal workers who were let go earlier this year. Now, DOGE is getting involved.

item.title: Top CDC Officials Resign After Director Is Pushed Out
item.description: The exodus has set off alarms among staff at the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: “My main concern is they will be replaced with puppets."

item.title: Top CDC Officials Resign After Director Is Pushed Out
item.description: The exodus has set off alarms among staff at the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: “My main concern is they will be replaced with puppets."

item.title: The Magic Phrase Behind Donald Trump’s Power Grab
item.description: The Trump administration frequently invokes the president’s priorities to justify its actions—regardless of whether they align with the law.

item.title: The Magic Phrase Behind Donald Trump’s Power Grab
item.description: The Trump administration frequently invokes the president’s priorities to justify its actions—regardless of whether they align with the law.

item.title: WIRED Roundup: The US Chip Manufacturers’ Bonanza
item.description: On this episode of “Uncanny Valley,” our senior business editor joins us to talk about the Trump administration’s deals with chipmakers, OpenAI’s potential $500 billion valuation—and ants.

item.title: WIRED Roundup: The US Chip Manufacturers’ Bonanza
item.description: On this episode of “Uncanny Valley,” our senior business editor joins us to talk about the Trump administration’s deals with chipmakers, OpenAI’s potential $500 billion valuation—and ants.

item.title: Trump Is Betting Big on Intel. Will the Chips Fall His Way?
item.description: The Trump administration is aiming to take an equity stake in Intel, according to US commerce secretary Howard Lutnick. Experts say the unconventional deal could backfire.

item.title: Trump Is Betting Big on Intel. Will the Chips Fall His Way?
item.description: The Trump administration is aiming to take an equity stake in Intel, according to US commerce secretary Howard Lutnick. Experts say the unconventional deal could backfire.

item.title: Government Staffing Cuts Have Fueled an Ant-Smuggling Boom
item.description: “It’s getting out of hand,” one seller says. “They realize the US market is a gold mine.”

item.title: How DOGE Set Up a Shadow X Account for a Government Agency
item.description: In February, DOGE affiliates at the SBA set up an X account and solicited whistleblower complaints. “It’s like having a crazy uncle who decides to be the cops,” a government auditor tells WIRED.

item.title: How DOGE Set Up a Shadow X Account for a Government Agency
item.description: In February, DOGE affiliates at the SBA set up an X account and solicited whistleblower complaints. “It’s like having a crazy uncle who decides to be the cops,” a government auditor tells WIRED.

item.title: Senate Probe Uncovers Allegations of Widespread Abuse in ICE Custody
item.description: Led by US senator Jon Ossoff, the investigation cites hundreds of reports since January, including accounts of miscarriages, child neglect, and sexual abuse at ICE detention centers in dozens of state

item.title: Decoding Palantir, the Most Mysterious Company in Silicon Valley
item.description: This week on Uncanny Valley, we talk about one of the most notorious American corporations. So what does Palantir actually do?

item.title: A DOGE AI Tool Called SweetREX Is Coming to Slash US Government Regulation
item.description: Named for its developer, an undergrad who took leave from UChicago to become a DOGE affiliate, a new AI tool automates the review of federal regulations and flags rules it thinks can be eliminated.

item.title: A DOGE AI Tool Called SweetREX Is Coming to Slash US Government Regulation
item.description: Named for its developer, an undergrad who took leave from UChicago to become a DOGE affiliate, a new AI tool automates the review of federal regulations and flags rules it thinks can be eliminated.

item.title: xAI Was About to Land a Major Government Contract. Then Grok Praised Hitler
item.description: Internal emails obtained by WIRED show a hasty process to onboard OpenAI, Anthropic, and other AI providers to the federal government. xAI was on the list—until MechaHilter happened.

item.title: xAI Was About to Land a Major Government Contract. Then Grok Praised Hitler
item.description: Internal emails obtained by WIRED show a hasty process to onboard OpenAI, Anthropic, and other AI providers to the federal government. xAI was on the list—until MechaHilter happened.

item.title: The Trump Administration Is Using Memes to Turn Mass Deportation Into One Big Joke
item.description: Memes shared by the White House, DHS, and ICE have used catchy TikTok tunes to normalize mass deportation and Christian nationalist narratives. Experts say that’s the point.

item.title: The Trump Administration Is Using Memes to Turn Mass Deportation Into One Big Joke
item.description: Memes shared by the White House, DHS, and ICE have used catchy TikTok tunes to normalize mass deportation and Christian nationalist narratives. Experts say that’s the point.

item.title: Inside the ‘Whites Only’ Community in Arkansas
item.description: Members have espoused racist and antisemitic views and repeatedly praised Adolf Hitler and the Nazi party. They’ve raised hundreds of thousands of dollars, and their movement is growing.

item.title: The Rise of the US Military’s Clandestine Foreign War Apparatus
item.description: Seth Harp’s new book, The Fort Bragg Cartel, goes deep into the forming of the Joint Special Operations Command and its origins in the aftermath of 9/11.

item.title: OpenAI Announces Massive US Government Partnership
item.description: The ChatGPT maker is providing its frontier AI models to federal agencies for $1 for the next year.

item.title: Trumpworld Knows Epstein Is a Problem. But They Can’t Solve It
item.description: Unmet expectations have pushed some of the president’s allies to the brink. “Honestly, like, fuck Trump,” a Trumpworld source who works in conservative media tells me.

item.description: Unmet expectations have pushed some of the president’s allies to the brink. “Honestly, like, fuck Trump,” a Trumpworld source who works in conservative media tells me.

item.title: Combating Domestic Violent Extremism Is No Longer a FEMA Priority
item.description: Documents obtained by WIRED show FEMA plans to direct states and tribes to halt activities intended to combat domestic violent extremism so as to align with “current administration priorities.”

item.title: Police Report: Edward ‘Big Balls’ Coristine Assaulted in Alleged Carjacking
item.description: President Donald Trump shared a photo of the DOGE staffer after the alleged attack and threatened to “federalize” Washington, DC. WIRED obtained the police report.

item.title: Palantir Is Extending Its Reach Even Further Into Government
item.description: Palantir has become one of the few winners in the Trump administration’s cost-cutting efforts, offering other contractors a lifeline while consolidating its own reach and power.

item.title: The Trump-Crypto Honeymoon Is Over
item.description: The flood of crypto money in the 2024 election was one of the biggest breaks for the Trump campaign. Six months into the term, the relationship might be cooling.

item.title: Photos: Here Are the Piles of Used Bedding and Children’s Play Sets Left Near DOGE’s Old Offices
item.description: Elon Musk’s DOGE minions have largely moved out of the General Services Administration. A dystopian scene of bedding and discarded kids’ toys remains.

item.title: The GOP's Message for Tech Billionaires: Be Like Peter Thiel
item.description: One lesson Republican insiders took away from Elon Musk’s spectacular flameout? Be wary of billionaires who love the spotlight.

item.title: Everything Is a ‘False Flag’ Now
item.description: Conspiracy theories about so-called false-flag attacks have been around for decades. But as trust in media and public institutions craters, every single major news event is now being labeled as fake.

item.description: Conspiracy theories about so-called false-flag attacks have been around for decades. But as trust in media and public institutions craters, every single major news event is now being labeled as fake.

item.title: ICE Is Getting Unprecedented Access to Medicaid Data
item.description: A new agreement viewed by WIRED gives ICE direct access to a federal database containing sensitive medical data on tens of millions of Americans, with the goal of locating immigrants.

item.title: ICE Is Getting Unprecedented Access to Medicaid Data
item.description: A new agreement viewed by WIRED gives ICE direct access to a federal database containing sensitive medical data on tens of millions of Americans, with the goal of locating immigrants.

item.title: DOGE Put Free Tax Filing Tool on Chopping Block After One Meeting With Lobbyists
item.description: A key operative from DOGE initiated plans to potentially kill Direct File, the free tax filing tool developed by the IRS, after offering assurances it would be spared from cuts.

item.title: It's Not Just Epstein. MAGA Is Angry About a Lot of Things
item.description: Pockets of Donald Trump’s most loyal base are increasingly angry at what they view as the administration’s failure to fulfill its promises.

item.title: Here's What We Know About DOGE 2.0
item.description: DOGE has continued to operate in full force in its post-Elon iteration. Today on Uncanny Valley, we tell you everything you need to know about the agency.

item.title: Tornado Cash Made Crypto Anonymous. Now One of Its Creators Faces Trial
item.description: Roman Storm, one of the developers of crypto-anonymizing tool Tornado Cash, will stand trial in New York starting July 14. His supporters claim the freedom to develop software is under threat.

item.description: Roman Storm, one of the developers of crypto-anonymizing tool Tornado Cash, will stand trial in New York starting July 14. His supporters claim the freedom to develop software is under threat.
